note.p: Education: BA (1808, Pembroke College, Oxford), MA (1813, Catherine Hall, Cambridge)
Career: Lecturer of Limehouse (1815); Chaplain to Prince Leopold, later King of the Belgians (1820); Chaplain to the Duke of York (1825); Chaplain to the Duke of Sussex (1831)
Notes: Disappeared from PL between 1832 and 1833 - see also letter in archives. Letter from A H Noble (31/12/64) is cited as a source in index to BR, as are Foster and Venn
